Provide a detailed analysis of the mineral alteration features visible in this hyperspectral image, including mineral types, distribution, and geological significance.

This image shows hydrothermal alteration with extensive Epidote (91.3%), minor Muscovite (8.7%), minor Kaolinite (0.1%). Total alteration coverage: 8.7%. Muscovite/sericite indicates phyllic alteration, commonly associated with porphyry systems.
